node.title: Prosecutors seek life for political donor's fatal fetish
node.description: Buck, 67, was convicted in July 2021.

node.title: Russia says 1000 Ukranian troops have surrendered in Mariupol
node.description: Russia's defence ministry said soldiers of the 36th Marine Brigade had surrendered in the port city, its main strategic target in eastern Ukraine.

node.title: Warning from ex-Russian leader on Finland or Sweden joining NATO
node.description: Moscow would put nuclear arms near the Baltics and Scandinavia if Finland or Sweden join the alliance, ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev said. The Kremlin didn't comment.

node.title: Actor Cuba Gooding Jr. pleads guilty to forcible touching
node.description: The guilty plea came nearly three years after Gooding's arrest in the case.

node.title: U.S. sending $800 million more in security aid to Ukraine as war shifts
node.description: The latest package will contain new capabilities for Ukraine including artillery systems, artillery rounds and armored personnel carriers.

node.title: Demise of golden toad shows climate's massive extinction threat
node.description: The golden toad was the first species where climate change has been identified as a key driver of extinction.

node.title: Pfizer to ask FDA to authorize COVID booster for kids as young as 5
node.description: Citing a "robust response" of antibodies against Omicron in their vaccine trials, the companies said they were planning to submit a request "in the coming days."

node.title: Elon Musk offers to buy Twitter for $43 billion
node.description: Billionaire founder of Tesla launches hostile bid for the social media company, saying it "needs to be transformed."

node.title: Shop owner fires at thieves, hits girl getting picture with Easter bunny
node.description: The girl was left with three gunshot wounds, her grandmother said. The store owner fled the state and was arrested in Nevada, authorities said.

node.title: Floods kill more than 300 as record rainfall swamps South Africa's coast
node.description: Touring devastation in Kwa-Zulu Natal province, President Cyril Ramaphosa promised residents that help was coming. But there's more rain coming, too.

node.title: Last-minute tax moves that can put money in your pocket
node.description: As the April 18 tax filing deadline nears, here are some tips for reducing what you owe or landing a bigger refund.

node.title: Wellington cafes see more customers with return of workers to CBD
node.description: Wellington cafes are celebrating the return of many workers back to the streets of the CBD.

node.title: Team appointed to investigate Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine storage failure
node.description: The cold chain storage failure meant almost 1600 people in Queenstown Lakes and Central Otago may not have been fully protected

node.title: Easter travel: watch out for Omicron in Central Otago and Queenstown
node.description: The Southern DHB is warning residents to be cautious as they travel to usual holiday hotspots as it seems Covid-19 has already arrived ahead of them.

node.title: East Coast relieved to escape worst of storm
node.description: Some East Coast towns are breathing a sigh of relief, after they escaped the worst in the latest big storm.

node.title: Bus drivers racially abused, threatened by teenagers
node.description: Tauranga bus drivers are facing racial abuse and death threats from local school boys hanging out at the city's transport hub, First Union says. Audio

node.title: $40k of electronics stolen from Auckland schools
node.description: Three west Auckland schools have had electronics stolen, prompting a police investigation.

node.title: Hubble telescope finds largest comet ever discovered
node.description: The comet is bigger than Rhode Island and could be "as big as 85 miles across," according to NASA.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 16 further deaths, 519 in hospital, 9563 new cases
node.description: There have been 9563 new community cases of Covid-19 reported today, along with 16 further deaths.

node.title: 'Up the creek': Builder blasts council over long wait for house inspections
node.description: Some builders are threatening to bypass council inspections due to "absurd" delays in getting staff on site.

node.title: Pair charged with firearms offences after West Auckland standoff
node.description: A man and woman have been charged with firearms offences after a standoff with police in West Auckland this morning.

node.title: What Americans pay in property taxes in every U.S. state
node.description: Buying a home? Don't overlook the impact of local property taxes on your budget, experts advise.

node.title: Dismay at secret NZ probe into Australia troops
node.description: A former Australian governor-general says he is "dismayed" at the revelation that NZ secretly investigated torture allegations against soldiers under his command in East Timor in 1999.

node.title: Ukraine war could worsen crises in Yemen and Afghanistan
node.description: While the world focuses on Ukraine, the UN warns humanitarian needs elsewhere in the world are also growing.

node.title: Phoenix win on the eve of their return home
node.description: The Wellington Phoenix have further entrenched themselves in the top six of the A-League before their long-awaited return home.

node.title: Greymouth hill report under fire
node.description: A proposal in the Te Tai o Poutini Plan for a land instability hazard area - cutting a swathe along the coastal hills behind Greymouth - has come under fire at the West Coast Regional Council.

node.title: Cost of living, soaring food prices: 'This is a survival issue'
node.description: Dramatically rising food prices are leading to a record number of families facing dire situations, according to a community non-profit organisation. Audio

node.title: Boaties urged to take care after girl's leg hit by propeller
node.description: Maritime New Zealand is urging boaties to know the risks after a child was seriously injured while out boating in Queenstown.

node.title: Cannabis farm gets $13m grant: 'New generation coming into agriculture'
node.description: The government has given a cash injection to the country's largest medicinal cannabis grower, saying it could become as successful as the wine industry.

node.title: Jury deliberates in case of British ISIS militant accused of kidnapping
node.description: Jury deliberates in case of El Shafee Elsheikh, one of three British men accused of brutal ISIS hostage-taking scheme.
